title: Pasta With Arugula, White Beans, And Walnuts
summary: Pasta With Arugula, White Beans, And Walnuts might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 4. One portion of this dish contains about 24g of protein, 20g of fat, and a total of 634 calories. For $2.5 per serving, this recipe covers 33% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up coarse salt and ground pepper, walnut pieces, cannellini beans, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the coarse salt you could follow this main course with the Healthy Raw Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. 25 people were impressed by this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a vegetarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is awesome. Try Pasta With White Beans and Arugula, Whole Wheat Pasta with Arugula, Gorgonzola, and Walnuts, and Pasta Salad with Blue Cheese, Walnuts and Arugula for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
